messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] chat experiment, on unschooling and food
messages.msgSnippet: That one went okay.   Two more are planned--midday Thursday (midday in north America) and Friday night (ditto). Details and a world time translator are here:
messages.messageBody:
That one went okay. Two more are planned--midday Thursday (midday in
north America) and Friday night (ditto).

Details and a world time translator are here:
http://sandradodd.blogspot.com/2009/01/live-chats-experiment.html

Thursdays will be on young children (at the request of a mom in
Montreal). 1:00 her time; 11:00 a.m my time; check your own time by
going to the link above, and at that hour go back to that link to get
into the chatroom.

Friday night, another one, on how it is people learn about
unschooling, and how they could do it better, maybe.
Same link.

Sandra

messages.subject: chat experiment, on unschooling and food
messages.msgSnippet: http://chat.aim.com/chats/life/unschooling-and-food I m going to keep this chat room open for a few hours and if anyone wants to come and join me to discuss
messages.messageBody:
http://chat.aim.com/chats/life/unschooling-and-food

I'm going to keep this chat room open for a few hours and if anyone
wants to come and join me to discuss food or the possibility of
scheduling more live chats is welcome.

It's 3:40 Wednesday afternoon in New Mexico. Your clockage may vary. <g>
I'll be there for a few hours, and the room will continue to exist for
24 hours after the last person leaves, as I understand it.

Maybe this is something worth scheduling once a week or more, if there
are others willing to host some chats maybe.

Sandra
